content: hat measures 5 ½ or desired length from brim edge ending with a row 4 for me this worked out to 16 pattern row or eight 2-row stripes finishing with a row 4 proceed to crown decrease all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2024kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit crown decrease this decrease is more difficult to describe than knit however if followed carefully it produces a very attractive seamless appearing decrease with no apparent break in the checkerboard pattern and after a few row you should get the hang of it be sure the last row you completed on the body is row 4 in the checkerboard pattern there should be two cc sts on the left-hand needle after the bor using markers in a different color than the bor divide the 96 sts on the needle into six groups of 16 and place markers when you need to switch from circular 2 dpn needles be sure the breaks between the needles fall at a point where a marker would have been this gap between needles substitutes for a marker in the directions below decrease row 1 note that the previous row ended with row 4 so the next row will start a color change *2 mc 2 cc* etc in addition to the decrease knit the first two cc sts together using mc resulting in one mc st on the right needle then continue in *2 cc 2 mc checkerboard pattern until two sts before next marker ssk two mc sts together with a cc yarn resulting in one cc st on right needle slip marker repeat the sequence above five more times until you reach the bor you should have decreased 12 sts and now have 84 sts on your needles around each marker there should be 1 cc st and 1 mc st decrease row 2 knit the pattern with mc sts over mc and cc sts over cc the checkerboard pattern has been broken around the six markers with just one of each color on either side this will be corrected in the next row decrease row 3 note there is a color change on this row knit the first two mc/cc sts together with mc yarn resulting in one mc st next knit one mc st you now have two mc sts on the right needle then continue in *2 cc 2mc checkerboard pattern until three sts before next marker knit one cc st and then ssk next two cc/mc sts with cc yarn now you have two cc st that pair together slip marker repeat this sequence five more times until you reach the bor you should have decreased another 12 sts and now have 72 sts on your needles the checkerboard pattern has now been reset and alternates with 2 mc sts and 2 cc sts decrease row 4 knit in checkerboard pattern with mc sts over mc
